Reviews.Title: “Good for the price”
Reviews.Author: HolFamTrav
Reviews.Content: My family and I planned a last minute trip to Dallas for the weekend and this place was right in our price range. The rooms were very clean, and big enough for my family of 5. We did not have time to get in the pool but we could smell it from the entry door, which was comforting to know that they were using the right stuff to keep it clean if we decided to use it. The staff was absolutely wonderful. They were courteous, quick and loved my daughters. They even rewarded them for being so quiet and polite during breakfast. Their breakfast was my only complaint. We got downstairs about 40 minutes before breakfast was over and there was not much left and we had to wait for more food and clean glasses. Since we had to pay an additional $10 for it they least they could have done was have it ready and plentiful for those who paid. Would I stay again because the hotel was very clean and well taken of and for the money we spent it was worth it. Not to mention that Alfredo, the gentleman at the front desk, was very kind and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing value”
Reviews.Author: RuthlessBunny
Reviews.Content: My parents live in Dallas and celebrated their 50th wedding anniversary this past weekend. A block of rooms was reserved for us at an outstanding rate of $49.00 per night. I've stayed here before, but I thought I'd update my reveiw. The hotel is immaculately maintained. If you've been in one Courtyard, you've been to this one, so no surprises here. I must say that the bed was too soft. I had a back-ache from our 15 hour drive and frankly the mushy matress did nothing for it. Everyone else liked the beds though. I'm a weirdo who likes a hard bed. Nice big bathroom, great water pressure, plenty of room to spread out and enjoy life. Kids went in the pool, and I enjoyed a nightly soak in the hot tub. There's one washer and one dryer on the property at $1.00 per load. Went to the laundromat down the street and did my wash there in very short order. Starbucks is to the right at Webb Chapel. Movie theater is there too. Quick Trip next door is an awesome convenience store with hot and cold food items (that are very tasty) and probably the best donuts anywhere. Very reasonably priced (as opposed to The Market) Our maid was awesome never disturbing us, the front desk did everything possible to help us out and even gave us some pennies for a game we could play on our trip back to Atlanta. There's a Motel 6 one exit before this, but at the same price, is there any contest?

Reviews.Title: “Decent Hotel, Not Exceptional - Very "Courtyard"”
Reviews.Author: step12dude
Reviews.Content: Check-in was handled efficiently by a very pleasant front desk person, who provided a warm greeting, recognized my Marriott "elite" status, and got me checked in quickly. My room was typical, traditional-style Courtyard, - very clean, with 2 double beds, desk, bureau with flat screen TV, and closent. Bathroom was clean, with thirsty towels and some basic amenities. I was on the 3rd floor, and the elevators are a fair distance from the lobby - not a big deal but worth noting. Location is on Forest Lane, just off Josey Lane, just south of I-635; about 15-20 minutes from the DFW airport. There is nothing special about this hotel - good or bad. It's your typical, traditional Courtyard style hotel, and if you want something clean, comfortable, and simple, you'll get it here. Hotel often goes on sale for weekend stays - enter code "MEB" when doing a search on marriott.com (this code is for weekend specials), and see if this hotel appears, before booking at a higher rate. I paid $44/night, which made it an excellent deal for the price - not much higher than Motel 6, but far better. The only issue I ran into is the water pressure in the shower - and this has been noted in other reviews. The hotel appears to use water-conserving shower heads, and while it's nice that they think "green,", it would be even nicer to get a nice, powerful rush of water when stepping into the shower in the morning. The water pressure isn't bad, but it could be better. Bottom line -- decent hotel, especially at special weekend rates. But not exceptional.

Reviews.Title: “some good, some not so good”
Reviews.Author: Sandonthebeach
Reviews.Content: Chose this hotel for one night in Dallas. Upside: Price was right. Alfredo, the night clerk was extremely helpful, as was Jesus for breakfast in the morning. Room was clean. Downside: No water pressure in the shower. Only got good water pressure when we turned the water to the full on position which was very hot. In-room, complimentary internet access was non-existant. At least we couldn't access the net and there were no instructions in the room. Since we're not techies, we did without. We asked for a room on the first floor. Although the place was almost empty, they gave us a room facing out, rather than into the courtyard. Very disappointed in this since our room had a patio door leading onto the parking lot. I would expect that unless requested, or unless the hotel was full, they'd assign inward facing first floor rooms FIRST. Then fill in with outward facing rooms as needed. As otheres have said about this hotel, either the televisions or the beds are in the wrong place. You need to lay on your side to watch from bed. All in all, it's an okay place, and we'd probably stay there again, but will shop around before staying again.

Reviews.Title: “A lot of bang for the buck”
Reviews.Author: fdipace
Reviews.Content: Just checked out of the hotel and was pleasantly surprised especially since I only paid $64/night. The room was not huge but it had a sofa and a large flat screen tv with a good selection of channels for a hotel. I had to move for business to the Embassy Suites at Market Center and I already miss the large flat screen tv. The Courtyard is not in the best area but it is easy to get on and off the highway, parking is free. The sheets were clean and although I don't like foam mattresses it was fine for sleeping. The A/C is the wall type but it worked great even though it is a little noisy. Although the hotel was full I didn't hear a thing in my room. Not sure why each room has a balcony because there is NOTHING to look at! I guess this would be good for smokers. The gym is small but the treadmill worked fine. Internet in the lobby didn't work well. I think they charge for breakfast but at this price who cares. Overall well worth the money.

Reviews.Title: “Nice for the money”
Reviews.Author: justherenow28
Reviews.Content: I had to make a trip to Dallas to pick up my kids who live in Texas and I was looking for something that was above Super 8 and Motel 6 quality but for a cheap price. I checked Holiday Inn brands and then looked out the window and seen the Court Yard across the street from my house and decided to check them in Dallas. Went online and checked prices and compared them to the Holiday Inn and seen they were pretty much the same so i booked online with this property. I decided to leave a day early and called to see if I could get the same rate if I arrived earlier and they said no, called reservations and they went ahead and gave me the same rate for both nights (Thurs and Fri $47/night with AAA). Exiting off the LBJ I realized that this part of town does not look the best. It is the kind of area that has the corner beer/wine store and some thugs hanging out, but I did not let that bother me I felt I was well protected. I arrived at the hotel and checked in and was given room 345 on the third (top) floor.The room was clean but rather small compared to other places I have stayed. It had a 42in LCD cable TV and small bathroom, patio area you could sit on (well, mine you could stand, it was one of the only ones with not furnature) if you wanted to brave the Dallas heat. I then walked to the desk to see what dining options there was since the hotel only serves breakfast. Although the clerk was friendly upon check-in he seemed to act as if coming back was a bother. Friday I got up and went for breakfast. They have a breakfast buffet with waffles, eggs, bacon, sausage, biscuts and gravy and a few other things. The breakfast was ok but nothing to write home about, and this is where i think the Holiday Inn has them beat. They charge $10.95 during the week and for the same food it is $11.95 on the weekend and the food in just plain, nothing special. What I like about Holiday Inn is that if I buy breakfast for me the kids eat free but not so at Court Yard. On Friday when my kids arrived I inquired about the Sponge Bob packages they were suppose to have for kids, it included a pillow case and some entertainment packs and I think a float toy for the pool, but nobody knew anything of it even though they had it advertised around the property. One thing I did not like was that they check out out in the middle of the night and go ahead and charge your credit card. I would prefer to see my bill and pay with the method of my choosing, but i admit I had planned on using that card, but in a lot of cases I just pay with cash. Had my bill been wrong I would have had to wait for reversals and such since they charged me as they did. Over all the place is nice, not as nice as the photos online make it look, but what place is as good as its pics? My bigget complaint was the pillows, they were so thin that it was like not having them. The bed itself was one of the most comfortable beds I have slept on but the pillows did not provide me with a great night sleep. One thing to note, although the area is not the best, I walked around a bit and felt safe during the day, I did not venture out at night. A little tip: There is a small donut shop down by the liquor store, they have some very good donuts and are cheap;

Reviews.Title: “GREAT PLACE FOR YOUR BUCK!”
Reviews.Author: PoloBear52
Reviews.Content: TOOK A ROADTRIP WITH A FRIEND AND THEY BOOKED OUR ROOM HERE AND I WAS NOT DISSAPOINTED. Our room was very clean and we had a neat little balcony that was really cool. The staff was nice and very helpful to us we needed directions to a restaurant, the clerk did a mapquest and printed out directions for us with no problems. Whirlpool was very nice and we also went for a swim in the pool. NEXT TIME IM IN DALLAS THIS IS WHERE I WILL BE STAYING 10-4!

Reviews.Title: “worth the money”
Reviews.Author: cowboy2806
Reviews.Content: I stayed there for two nites and it really was worth the money. big rooms, flat screen tv, nice beds. everything clean. i would go there again. the only bad thing: in the bathroom which was tiney by the way laid hairs behind the door and werenÂ´t removed. thatÂ´s why i doublechecked the linens but they were ok. the front desk clerk was nice and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Affordable and well worth the travel.”
Reviews.Author: InspiredTalent
Reviews.Content: Great hotel for a relaxing few nights away from everything.. Nice, courteous, respectful staff. Clean, quiet.. I enjoyed my stay here a few weeks ago. NO BUGS, NO MOLD SMELL as some one was referring to.. Overall this hotel is my favorite.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Haley2930
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Courtyard LBJ and found one of the best hotel is Texas. It was very clean, and hotel service was the best around. The manager even took time to visit our table during breakfast to make sure eveything was great with our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Cockroaches brought 3.5-Star down to 1.5-Star”
Reviews.Author: ALAR_Traveler
Reviews.Content: I booked this room on Priceline in order to stay within my company budget. The hotel is not near any major restaurants or bars within walking distance; it is close to the airport. However, with Priceline, you get random hotel choice on a bid, but the star quality rating is solid. That said, I checked into the room and the a/c was off. I watched TV and it went out, so I took a nap while the cable repairman worked on it. While sleeping, I felt a tickle of sweat on my neck. I wiped it away only to find it wasn't sweat but a large cockroach. I threw it against a wall and screamed while another roach crawled up my bare leg. The roach on the wall scurried into my shoe, and I was able to capture it under a water glass (I took a video and picture). I called the desk enraged; demanding they relocate me to another Marriott and comp my stay. I also demanded to speak to a manager and have one come up to witness the roach. The clerk got in touch with the manager, but, instead of the manager talking to me, he left the clerk in charge. A maintenance man came up to the room and verified it was a very large roach. The clerk said they would not pay for me to go to another hotel and offered to switch rooms. This was unacceptable. They did credit my Priceline payment and, instead of walking me to another Marriott at a comparable rate, they gave me a Priceline operator and had me make a reservation at another hotel. They refused to pay for my 1st hotel night stay or offer any other compensation. For the record: Priceline would have refunded my money, so the manager was not doing me any favors. I called Marriott Corp as the manager would only communicate via email and through his clerk (apparently). Corp kept sending me back to the manager, where he offered me a 2-night stay next time I'm in town along with a template letter apology. I explained that they owed my company the difference in cost between what I paid for the Marriott vs where I made last minute reservations via Priceline. I also called Priceline and Marriott Corp saying that this hotel should be stripped of their Marriott banner and/ or be dropped (at least) two stars for poor management and infestation. The manager continued to sugar coat the cockroach's description by calling it a Palmetto Bug and Waterbug. Both which are pretty names for "The American Cockroach", of which there were two (2) crawling on my body. I included a picture and do not recommend that anyone stay at this establishment; nor would I EVER stay here regardless of the offer to stay for free.

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience”
Reviews.Author: Jdubj
Reviews.Content: My family took a weekend trip to Dallas and absolutely loved this hotel. It was clean, inexpensive, rooms were big, and hotel service was GREAT. We stayed in a 2 bedroom suite, I was very pleased at how roomy it was even compared to some of the more expensive 4/5 star hotels my family has stayed at.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, nice pool/spa and easy access to highway”
Reviews.Author: jim_from_sf
Reviews.Content: We were stuck overnight at DFW and decided to make the best of it so booked a room here at the last minute with an online web site. For the rate we were paying, I didn't expect much, and the hotel far, far exceeded the expectations. I felt as if we should have paid more money. The pool was lovely, as was the hot tub. It even has a well-equipped exercise room. It is close to the Dallas north tollway, so it was really easy to get into the middle of Dallas (about 15 min. drive). If you need to stay in the Dallas area, and don't mind driving some, you won't have any complaints at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, great rate”
Reviews.Author: carverfam
Reviews.Content: We stayed over the weekend while visiting family in the area for $59 including the breakfast buffet. The area is not the greatest along the interstate, but we were aware of this and didn't plan to be in/out late at night, etc. The room was very clean, the staff very friendly and the breakfast buffet (we paid $59 instead of $49 for it to be included) was great....eggs, meat, French toast, fresh fruit...what you would expect from a Marriott. Small, but nice pool area with room balconies overlooking courtyard (could probably get loud inside rooms if there was a crowd.) We will return.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, but dicey neighborhood”
Reviews.Author: BenjaB
Reviews.Content: I only stayed here one night and thought it was fine -- the staff were very helpful and friendly and the room was spacious. (I only found out later that it was in a bad part of town.) The bed was OK but the pillows were very uncomfortable. Would I stay there again? For the hotel, I might, but considering the neighborhood, I would really think about other options.

Reviews.Title: “Stay at your own risk”
Reviews.Author: TexasTennismom
Reviews.Content: Decent hotel, but very risky neighborhood. There were THREE attempted car thefts in the parking lot on one of the nights we stayed. One of our family members' car was one that was hit. It was not driveable and had to be towed. Major hassle to get rental car, etc. We did not get the rate we were promised and the continental breakfast was very minimal. They did not provide enough towels & washcloths for the room and had a hard time reaching the housekeeping dept. Stay at your own risk!

Reviews.Title: “Great value”
Reviews.Author: iluvthecubs
Reviews.Content: We were able to book for three nights at a great rate. Our room was very clean and comfortable and had plenty of work space. The bed was comfy and even the view from the balcony was very nice as it overlooked a nicely landscaped courtyard. The neighborhood is not great, but there is a nice convenience store right next door and the hotel property felt very safe. For the price, it was a great deal.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Safe, and Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: d467
Reviews.Content: I really enjoyed my stay at this hotel. Great value, good location, comfy beds and pillows. There is a coffee maker in the room. No refrigerator. I guess our stay was after all of the renovations had been done because everything was in working order when we arrived. There is an ample amount of free parking spaces. At night, there is a security patrol car that circles the parking lot and it was very quiet. We were able to get a good night's sleep. The only downside about this hotel is that the walls are paper thin. Luckily we had quiet neighbors. Although we were able to hear one of them very clearly coughing and sneezing. I will definately return to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Top marks for this Courtyard!”
Reviews.Author: abqtravelermta
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this Courtyard shortly after renovations were finished and I have to say they did a nice job. I arrived after dark and the neighborhood felt kind of "sketchy" but once in the hotel I felt safe. Front desk staff at check-in was great; I was travelling without my laptop and they helped me find a Kinkos where I could get on-line. The hotel is not far (10-15 minutes, if that) from "Restaurant Row" so finding something to eat at 9:00 PM was easy. My room was newly renovated and spotlessly clean. I found the bed to be most comfortable. My room connected to the adjacent room so rather than a sofa I had a very comfortable oversized chair. Rooms have been upgraded with refrigerator and microwave. I was only staying the night and had an early monring so I didn't get to use the hot tub or exercise room and I didn't have time for breakfast in the restaurant. I utilized "express" check out which meant I could by-pass the front desk and be on my way. In daylight the neighborhood looked better and I would not hesitate to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Completely Serviceable”
Reviews.Author: Buzzkillbunny
Reviews.Content: I had a family reunion to attend in Dallas and I had Marriott points to spend, so I decided to stay at this location due to its convenience to my family. The gentlemen at the desk seemed a bit confused about how to process my pre-paid (with points) reservation, but he got it all sorted out in decent time. I had requested a non-smoking room and was informed that the hotel was 100% smoke free. Someone should have passed that information onto the folks who had the room before me because it REEKED! There are fabric deodorizers and I think the room needed to be saturated, the smell was so ingrained. But I'm made of stern stuff, and pretty much, that was the worst I can say about the place. The building is arranged around a pool and spa area, so my arcadia door opened onto a patio and the hot tub. I like a window you can actually open. I didn't eat breakfast because Courtyard does not provide it free, and I'm not paying $12 for what I can get at a diner for $4. Besides, my mom cooked, so I didn't need breakfast. The hotel does provide cookies, tea and coffee throughout the day, which is a nice touch. I never did find the ice machine, but the security guy was very friendly and helpful and got me ice from the kitchen. As a Silver level member, I was provided with a 16 oz bottle of water. I wonder why they bothered. I'll be staying here at Thanksgiving. It's the least expensive Courtyard I've stayed at. The beds are indeed firm. I love a hard bed so I was in heaven. The a/c unit was noisy and it was hard to keep the room at a constant temperature. It's along side the LBJ, but you don't hear any freeway noise. The location is good if you need to be in this area or close to the freeway, but it's not near anything and at night, it can get desolate. There's a QT gas station next door to the hotel. You can get fountain drinks, coffee, snack cakes, chips, candy and a variety of hot and cold sandwiches, so if you're stuck here, you don't have to go hungry. (If you're willing to eat a gas station hot dog.)

Reviews.Title: “From OK to No Way”
Reviews.Author: johnmig
Reviews.Content: Paint splattered elevators and entrance, no fitness center, having to wait on workers to let us use elevators and entrance ways. Signage in wrong locations and placed wrong. Beds that are sooooo firm they will last forever because it is almost impossible to sleep on them. All the above was the good things about our stay in the newly renovated section of this "helltel". Staff could care less about your problems, but I'm not sure how. I know I previously said not to stay here during construction, but I honestly thought it would be over by now. Evidently it may never end. One of the worst rehab's of a property in my over 30 years in the construction business all over the country. Bad color schemes, wrong decor blends in rooms, useless colorful sash's at the ends of the beds, sorry I used to do punch lists for a living before I retired and it's hard to stop once I get started. Avoid this place, go to a Hampton Inn instead, they're nicer and cheaper too.

HotelInfo.Name: Courtyard by Marriott Dallas LBJ at Josey
HotelInfo.Address: 2930 Forest Lane, Dallas, TX 75234
